titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. John W. Flora and George Herendon, Indictment

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

body.p:
Campbell Circuit Court
The Com"mth of Kentucky Plaintiff
Against } Indictment for refusing to receive the vote of a qualified voter
John W Flora & Geo Herendon Defendants

The Grand Jury of Campbell County, in the name and by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky, accuse John W. Flora and George Herendon of the offense of refusing to receive the vote of a qualified voter -- Committed as follows, viz; the Said John W Flora and Geo Herendon, on the day of August, 1865, and on divers other days and times, before and Since that time, and before the finding of this Indictment, in the County and State aforesaid, Being Officers of an Election then & there held, at the Carthage Precinct, in Said County, under the Constitution and laws of the State aforesaid
, for the purpose Election of a member of the Congress of the United States, for the Sixth Congressional District of Ky, a State Treasurer, a Senator from the 25th Senatorial District of Said State, Two members of the General Assembly for the county aforesaid, and a Clerk of the Circuit Court for the County aforesaid the Said Flora being then & there a Judge of Said Election, and the Said Herendon being then & there the Sheriff of Said Election, and Severally acting as Such at the time & place aforesaid, having been duly appointed and qualified as said Judge & Sheriff, The Jury aforesaid in the name and by the authority aforesaid, do further say, that at the Election aforesaid, and for the purpose aforesaid at the Precinct and County aforesaid, on the day and year aforesaid Turner Parsons, a qualified voter of Said Precinct and County, did then & there appear before at the Polls, before the Judges, Sheriff
and clerk of Said Election, between the hours of Seven Oclock A. M. and Seven Oclock P. M. and then & there, did offer to vote, whereupon the Said John W. Flora and George Herendon as Judge and Sheriff aforesaid, Respectively did knowingly unlawfully and corruptly refuse to receive the vote of the Said Turner Parsons, contrary to the Statutes in such cases made and provided, and against the piece and dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky,

Witnesses
Jno J Nelson
Turner Parsons,

A Copy
Attest Benj Beall clk
Campbell Circuit Court

159
The Commonwealth
against
John W Flora & Geo Herendon
Indictment for refusing to receive the vote of a qualified voter
A True Bill
G. W. Carmack
Foreman
Filed 25 Aug 1865
B W issd Aug 28 "
